Posts.Content: Thank you Didee. Complete shock to realize I will not make it three years from now - and I saw a surgeon who told me I had months! I do not want to go back to her.
Posts.Signature: 3.25.13: breast cancer stage4, met to lymph nodes and spine CT Scan, hospitalized. Several ultrasounds. 3.26.13: Paracentesis, 5 liters fluid removed Suspected ovarian cancer as a second primary C125 test confirms ovarian 4.12.13: PET scan 4.10.13: Gyn oncologist appt
Posts.Title: New Here

Posts.Content: Just diagnosed with stage4 breast cancer spread to lymph nodes and spine - and ovarian (separate primary). Have ascites, which is what brought me to a doctor 2 weeks ago. Apparently the fluid has both breast cancer and ovarian cancer cells in it. Having a PET scan tomorrow and will be glowing all over Seeing the Gyn Oncologist on Wed.
Posts.Title: New Here

Posts.Content: I just had a biopsy on a breast mass and lymph node last week and lidocaine was used to numb the area. That stung a bit and when he hit a nerve in the armpit - wow! Even with the lidocaine. I hope you doctor was only referring to general anesthesia. I recommend a local one for sure. Originally Posted by mary_athens_greece I am scheduled for a needle biopsy on Monday, to examine two cysts identified in my left breast yesterday, on mammogram and ultrasound. My OB said there is no need for anesthesia and that it is uncomfortable but only lasts for a short time. I don't actually trust his pain assessment as he is not the one taking the tests. I would appreciate info from any lady who has gone through this procedure. I am definitely having the biopsy, I just want to be prepared for what is in store and need to know if I must have someone there with me or can I just go in alone? I don't have much of a support system, so I will need to make extra arrangements if I need to be accompanied. Thanks for any input you can offer!
Posts.Title: does a breast needle biopsy hurt?

Posts.Content: These tests are only as good as the doctors interpreting them. It sure sounds to me that something is not right! I hope you find a health professional who will look at you as more than a test.
